Posts.Content: zymurgist wrote: Shouldn't they make a Hallmark card for your first mammo?  It could say something like this: "Today is your day, get plenty of rest. Sorry they had to squish your breast." Trying to stay sane and keep laughing, but still pretty scared. REALLY hoping I don't have to have the ductography done. They'd better give me a sticker or a lollipop or something!   Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: My first mammogram... zymurgist Hedberg3312

Posts.Content: Sep 24, 2009 06:42PM zymurgist wrote: no lump, but I had some bloody discharge that had to come from SOMEWHERE! :)
Posts.Title: confused... zymurgist

Posts.Content: zymurgist wrote: I survived my mammo and ultrasound on Tuesday.  The radiologist talked to me and said that he couldn't see anything, but would send my imaging to my doc.  Maybe it's just me, but I thought there would be SOMETHING on one of those tests.... I'm relieved that they looked clear, but not reassured.  Should I be worried about false negatives?  Get a second opinion?  I just don't know what to do! Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: confused... zymurgist

Posts.Content: Sep 17, 2009 09:59PM zymurgist wrote: Hi! I just want to say thanks to all of you for being here... I'm 29 and started having bloody discharge a couple weeks ago, and even though it stopped after a couple of days, my doc wanted me to take the express train to mammogram city... she said it's partially because of my family history (aunt and grandma both BC survivors), and partially because I've been dealing with galactorrhea for the last 10 years.  Anyway, it's good to be able to read about others' experiences so that at least I know a little about what to expect. The good news is that I qualify for a breast & cervical cancer program in my state that will cover everything (I'm uninsured...).  I'm going to stop my rambling (for now).  :-D Thanks!
